title: Delhi man falls to death in pit: Jal Board suspends three officials, govt orders probe
'Didn't make a mistake': Trump refuses to apologise for post depicting Obamas as apes
description: President Trump refused to apologise for a racist video depicting the Obamas as apes, which he posted and then deleted. He claimed he hadn't seen the offensive content and blamed a staffer, despite acknowledging he watched part of it. The White House initially defended the post before stating a staffer made an error.

title: 2.09 crore voters to decide fate of 12 ZPs, 125 panchayat samitis today
How ready are defending champions India for T20 World Cup title defence at home?
description: Defending champions India enter the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 as overwhelming favourites, showcasing a revitalised squad under Suryakumar Yadav. Following a generational shift, the team has embraced a high-octane philosophy, boasting a dominant recent record and top-ranked players. India aim for a third title with a confident, albeit with a few lingering concerns, lineup.

title: Navjot Kaur Sidhu expelled from Congress, days after she ‘quit’ party
description: Navjot Kaur Sidhu, wife of senior Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, countered by launching a sharp attack, in an apparent dig at party leader Rahul Gandhi

title: Delhi cop held after girlfriend shoots self dead with his service pistol in Noida Extension
description: A Delhi Police head constable was arrested after his girlfriend allegedly shot herself with his service pistol following an argument triggered by a call from his wife. The 34-year-old woman, who was in a relationship with the married constable for five years, succumbed to her injuries. Her family alleges the constable lied about his marital status and pressured her.

India-US trade pact momentum builds with interim framework, full agreement likely by next month

Parliament is being hollowed out
A panchayat dream and a daughter’s murder
description: On January 29, a girl’s body was found in the Nizam Sagar distributary canal in Telangana’s Nizamabad. The police say the girl’s father killed her, his firstborn, so that his wife could contest the panchayat election. Under Maharashtra’s rules, candidates with more than two children cannot contest local elections and the couple had three. Marri Ramu travels to Nizamabad and Nanded to trace the sequence of the tragedy

title: Propaganda against Manmohan insult to Sikh faith: Kharge
Don’t drop everything just to do AI: Tech Matters’ CEO Jim Fruchterman warns nonprofits
Usman Tariq's untold story: A cricketing journey inspired by MS Dhoni's biopic
description: Usman Tariq has lately grabbed attention for his bowling action despite being cleared of any wrongdoing by the ICC. The Pakistan spinner has had a life worthy of a Bollywood movie: lost his father early, struggled to survive as a youngster and turned to cricket inspired by MS Dhoni's biopic.

title: Iran says ‘good start’ made in talks with US over nuclear programme
No tariff cut likely for US grains, meat, animal feed
description: India is set to protect its agriculture and dairy sectors by placing items like animal feed, ethanol, poultry, flowers, and tea on a negative list for US import concessions. Rice, wheat, cereals, and GM food products will also remain off-limits, safeguarding local farmers and addressing concerns over genetically modified imports.

title: ‘Where does it go that he eats so much?’: Yuzvendra Chahal spills the beans on his unconventional breakfast
3rd extension in UP SIR: 1 more month for filing claims
description: The Election Commission has granted a one-month extension for filing claims and objections on Uttar Pradesh's draft electoral rolls, now allowing submissions until March 6. This marks the third extension for the state's voter list revision, with the final rolls to be published on April 10.

title: 2020-24: Defence Ministry cleared 35 books, General Naravane’s only one pending
Maharashtra drops physical verification for Ladki Bahin scheme, extends e KYC deadline to March 31

Digital fraud cases: RBI plans compensation up to Rs 25,000 even if victim shares OTP
Backlift like Lara, world champion at 14: Rise and rise of unconventional Sooryavanshi
description: Still two-years younger than what Sachin Tendulkar's age was at the time of his India debut, he has a bat-swing that reminds of Brian Charles Lara, Harmanpreet Kaur, and Yuvraj Singh, and like footballer Lamine Yamal, who has emerged as a teenage sensation at the highest level, Sooryavanshi’s age has rarely matched the stage he performs on.

title: Urban consumer confidence declines, reflects growing caution on economic conditions: RBI survey
Monetary Policy Meet: Repo rate steady at 5.25%; FY26 GDP, inflation projections raised
From Raza to Rehan: 30 Pakistan-origin cricketers set to play in T20 WC
description: The 2026 T20 World Cup will showcase 30 players of Pakistani origin representing 10 different nations, underlining how modern cricket transcends borders. From UAE’s Muhammad Jawad Ullah to Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza and England’s Rehan Ahmed, it shows how cricket has moved beyond rigid ideas of nationality and has become more inclusive and diverse by embracing migrants.

title: India, US reach interim trade pact framework: What's in the deal
description: India and the United States have agreed to a framework for an interim trade deal, signaling a de-escalation of recent trade tensions. This agreement reaffirms their commitment to broader Bilateral Trade Agreement negotiations. The US also lifted punitive tariffs imposed on Indian goods over its Russian oil imports.

title: Gujarat’s Chhari-Dhandh on global Ramsar Map
description: Gujarat Forest and Environment Minister Arjun Modhwadia, on behalf of the Forest Department, presented the Ramsar Site certificate to Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel in Gandhinagar

Trump signs executive order lifting 25% tariff penalty on India
description: US President Donald Trump has revoked the additional 25% tariff on Indian imports, previously imposed due to New Delhi's Russian oil purchases. This decision follows a recent trade deal where India agreed to reduce these imports. The move aims to ease trade tensions and comes as India has already begun scaling back its Russian oil acquisitions.

description: Rajasthan’s stone and architecture were recognised worldwide because of their distinct qualities, Deputy CM Diya Kumari said

description: The Congress party on February 5, 2026, announced that it will contest independently in all the 294 Assembly constituencies in West Bengal, ending speculation of any electoral understanding with the Left Front in the polls due in next few months

description: A press statement issued by the Haryana Public Relations Department said that products made by the inmates were available at stalls number 1130 to 1133, 1135 and 1136, set up by the Prisons Department at the fair

title: ‘The Strangers: Chapter 3’ movie review: About time to put this killer to pasture
description: All the back and forth, mincing machines, cleavers, dank basements, creep chords, jump scares and gore do not translate into even halfway decent thrills

title: 'When told I'm 75, I said 25 yrs left': PM Modi tells students to focus on future
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi advised students at 'Pariksha Pe Charcha' that education is for life, not just exams, emphasizing character and temperament over grades. He encouraged focusing on future goals rather than dwelling on past achievements, urging them to live in the present and plan for what lies ahead.

title: 'I don't know what will happen to me': Pappu Yadav after arrest in 1995 case
description: Purnea MP Pappu Yadav was arrested by Patna Police in connection with a 1995 case, expressing fears for his safety and demanding to be taken directly to court. He questioned the police's methods and the timing of the arrest. The MP was later admitted to hospital due to health concerns.

title: Nitu, Preeti, Jadumani storm into semis as India confirm 19 medals in Spain
description: The Indian women’s team, under the guidance of new head coach Santiago Nieva, has confirmed 12 medals, while the seven male boxers progressed to the semifinals

title: T20 World Cup: Avoiding outside noise best way, says Salman as Pakistan eye Super Eight
description: Pakistan, who won the title in 2009, are coming into the tournament in the wake of their decision to boycott the February 15 group game against arch-rivals India in solidarity with Bangladesh, who were replaced by Scotland after refusing to travel to India citing security concerns

description: Iranian Army blamed an electrical fault for the fire

description: Emerging challenges driven by advanced technology must be countered with equally advanced technological solutions. The challenges faced some years ago are completely different from those faced today, says Union Home Minister Amit Shah

title: RBI plans ₹25,000 compensation for cyberfraud victims
description: For such small-value fraudulent transactions, which constitute 65% of online frauds, no questions will be asked to the victim if she/he has even given an OTP

title: Minor has right over reproductive choice: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court permitted a minor's pregnancy termination, acknowledging her right to reproductive autonomy and the lifelong trauma of an illegitimate child. Despite the Maharashtra government's concerns about a 30-week fetus's viability and the suggestion of an orphanage, the court prioritized the girl's mental well-being, directing the procedure with medical safeguards.

title: Earphones blast in woman’s ear causing hearing loss: How to protect yourself and use them safely
Stacy Lewis & Gerrod Chadwell net worth: recovery, wins, earnings & future
description: Stacy Lewis, a highly respected LPGA golfer with 13 titles including two majors, announced her retirement after the 2025 season. Over her 17-year career, she earned over $14.6 million and achieved the world number one ranking. Lewis overcame early scoliosis challenges to build a successful career, balancing motherhood and competition.

title: India trashes Pakistan's allegations of Indian link to Islamabad bombing
description: “It is unfortunate that, instead of seriously addressing the problems plaguing its social fabric, Pakistan should choose to delude itself by blaming others for its home-grown ills,” the Ministry of External Affairs said

title: Exports to China up 37% in Apr-Dec: Minister
description: India's exports to China surged 37% to $14.2 billion in April-December, with December shipments jumping 67%. Imports, however, rose 13.5% to nearly $96 billion during the same period. The government highlighted that most Chinese imports are capital and intermediate goods, crucial for India's expanding electronics, pharma, and telecom sectors.

title: Timely police action could’ve saved his life, say Kamal’s kin

title: Iran backs Chabahar port, ready to expand ties with India
description: Iran reaffirms its commitment to the Chabahar port and cooperation with India, despite US sanctions uncertainty. While a recent budget showed no allocation, India has fulfilled its $120 million commitment and maintains a $250 million credit line for future development. Iran's ambassador highlighted the port's strategic importance for regional access and expressed confidence in India's management of the situation.

title: Bystanders cannot be ‘picked up’ as part of mob: Delhi HC on Turkman Gate violence
Can't misuse judiciary after poll drubbing: Supreme Court
description: The Supreme Court sternly criticized the Jan Suraaj Party for challenging Bihar's assembly elections, questioning their motive after a significant electoral defeat. Justices noted the party's failure to win any seats and suggested their petition aimed at gaining popularity. The court emphasized that economic policy issues are for voters to address, not judicial annulment of elections.

title: Detroit Pistons vs New York Knicks: Preview, lineups, injuries & more
description: The New York Knicks are set to face the Detroit Pistons tonight at 7:30 pm ET. The Knicks, with a 33-18 record, rely on Jalen Brunson and Mikal Bridges. The Pistons, holding a 37-13 record, look to Cade Cunningham and Ausar Thompson for victory. Several key players are listed as questionable or out for both teams.

title: Cooper Kupp’s wife Anna posts emotional message ahead of Super Bowl 2026
description: Cooper Kupp, the Seattle Seahawks' star player, seems to be fully focused for Super Bowl LX on Sunday as he gears up to take the field against the New England Patriots in Levi Stadium, California. Amid this, his wife, Anna, has shared a few words that reflect how the family is gearing up for the big day and how she is supporting him.

title: ​Distressing regularity: On Meghalaya’s rat-hole mines
description: Illegal mining should become socially expensive and operationally prohibitive

title: Top Jaish, LeT men call for jihad, threaten to strike Delhi, Agra
description: Top commanders from Pakistan-based terror groups JeM and LeT have issued direct threats against India and global powers during rallies coinciding with 'Kashmir Solidarity Day'.  Speeches incited violence, calling for jihad and targeting major Indian cities like Delhi and Agra.  Intelligence agencies are on high alert for potential cross-border attacks.

title: ‘Hop-on, hop-off’ — the state of climate governance
description: There is an illusion of progress in climate negotiations, with more process and less action

title: Brothers held on charge of supplying drugs to minor boy, stealing gold
India’s rare earths push finds possible ally in Germany’s wind energy needs
description: New Delhi’s announcements of a rare earth corridor and permanent magnets manufacturing programme could align with Berlin’s plan to scale up its offshore wind capacity; the initiatives for a domestic supply chain come as Germany and Europe are planning to diversify their reliance on China

title: In a 1st, resolution professional held by ED for colluding with promoters of bankrupt co
description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Arvind Kumar, a former resolution professional for Richa Industries Ltd., on charges of collusion, asset siphoning, and money laundering during insolvency proceedings. This marks the first such arrest of an RP by an enforcement agency. The ED's investigation revealed unexplained cash deposits and illicit fund transfers linked to the company's original bank fraud.

title: Bangladesh elections: BNP promises to end ‘border killings’ by BSF, seeks fair share of cross border rivers
description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party released its election manifesto, promising to end ‘border killings’ by the BSF, claiming fair share of common rivers with India and increased cooperation with Gulf countries

description: The economic deal opens up avenues for India and the EU to stabilise the international order

title: Work on second phase of metro likely to be completed by Dec. 2026, says KMRL
description: KMRL managing director cites delays in piling caused by detection of a gas pipeline between Alinchuvadu and Padamugal, and the unavailability of land for Chembumukku and Padamugal stations as major obstacles to meeting the June deadline

title: Lowering age of consent will undermine child safety: Govt
description: The Union government has rejected the Supreme Court's suggestion to introduce a "Romeo-Juliet" clause for "genuine adolescent relationships" under the Pocso Act. Citing child safety concerns, the government stated that diluting the age of consent would increase exploitation risks and undermine child protection efforts.

title: Kayla Nicole says 'everyone has a breaking point' amid Swift‑Kelce romance
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's relationship might have turned heads over the last two years but it has pulled in his ex girlfriend, Kayla Nicole, into the drama. Over the last two years, ever since Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce went public with their relationship, Kayla Nicole has been shamed for her appearances and her opinions. Amid this, she had opened up about the pain she felt.

title: ‘Ludicrous idea of romance…’: After Zeenat Aman revisits old problematic scenes from her movies, an expert on unlearning toxic relationship scripts
Over the years, DMK and Congress have forged a mutually complementary electoral tie-up
description: In the 2024 Lok Sabha election, even though the national party lagged behind the Dravidian party in terms of vote share in contested seats, the margin was less than one percentage point; the narrow gap in vote shares indicates that all the parties in the alliance benefit from one another

Supreme Court to examine HP decision to withdraw cases against 65 netas
description: Himachal Pradesh government has approached the Supreme Court. They are challenging a High Court ruling. The ruling prevented the withdrawal of 65 cases against politicians. These cases involve non-serious offenses. The government believes withdrawing these cases serves public interest. The Supreme Court has issued a notice and will hear the matter further.

title: Statewide firefighting training programme for security guards to be held on Monday

description: Only 68% of the work has been completed; the ₹55.84-crore project that was initiated in 2020 to mitigate flood risk in southern suburbs and augment water supply has run into legal hurdles

‘ALERT Being’ awards presented in Coimbatore
Pvt, more than govt, colleges gain from NEET PG cut-off drop
description: NEET PG cut-off reduction to zero in 2023 disproportionately benefited private medical colleges, especially for clinical specialties. General category candidates saw the largest gains, with a significant portion of these seats going to them. The analysis highlights admissions with extremely low scores, raising questions about data completeness.

title: PM Modi must answer questions related to national security in Parliament, says Congress MP
Toll on partially opened e-ways like Delhi-Mumbai to be same as that of other NHs
description: Commuters using partially operational expressways like Delhi-Mumbai will now pay the same toll as normal national highways. This relief, effective for one year or until full operationalization, addresses concerns that higher tolls deterred usage of incomplete stretches. The decision aims to boost traffic on these corridors.

title: Two employees of software firm arrested for swindling off ₹29 lakh
Panaiyur residents oppose as TVK cadre gather at party headquarters to collect poll papers
50 lakh bought FASTag Annual Pass; 50% rise in short trips
description: Over 50 lakh highway car users have embraced the FASTag Annual Pass in six months, facilitating 26.5 crore toll payments. This scheme has spurred a 50% surge in trips for frequent travelers, with 28% of car transactions now utilizing the pass. Chandigarh, Tamil Nadu, and Delhi lead in adoption, paving the way for barrier-less toll collection.

title: Change of phase: opportunity knocks for India’s young hockey talent
description: The men’s team needs an injection of fresh blood in the run-up to the 2028 Olympics. The packed calendar in 2026 may prove a blessing in disguise — head coach Craig Fulton can use it as a base to experiment, giving lesser-known faces exposure, and trigger a smooth transition

title: Chennai Corporation conducts training programme for desilting stormwater drains

description: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah presented a Rs 1.27-lakh crore budget for 2026-27, addressing challenges from recent attacks and floods. The budget includes provisions for emergency hospitals, bullet-proof ambulances, fee waivers for economically weaker students, and support for orphans and disabled individuals. Opposition leaders criticized the budget, calling it uninspiring and a repackaging of central schemes.

description: SpaceX faces a significant hurdle in attracting engineers and technicians to its Starbase facility in South Texas due to limited job prospects for their spouses. This challenge, though less pronounced, also affects Tesla's recruitment in Texas.

This transformative treatment led to a rapid recovery and a return to an active, cancer-free life.

title: Google CEO thinks bloodbath in markets in reaction to Anthropic is overblown
description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang dismiss market panic over AI plugins, calling it overblown. Despite a significant selloff in software stocks triggered by Anthropic's legal AI tools, they argue AI will enhance, not replace, existing software, enabling greater productivity and innovation.
